# The Leader’s Guide to Transforming with AI

After all the hype over [artificial intelligence](https://www.bcg.com/capabilities/artificial-intelligence), only one in four companies have cracked the code and are [finding real value](https://www.bcg.com/publications/2024/wheres-value-in-ai). Most are still stuck, unable to translate experiments into real business impact. So what sets the leaders apart? They’re using BCG’s three AI value plays, Deploy, Reshape, and Invent: deploying the technology for immediate productivity gains, reshaping critical functions, and inventing new revenue streams by developing novel products and services.

For these high-achieving companies, the true value of AI lies in end-to-end transformation. Leaders understand that AI supports business strategy—and they are finding real-world results by thinking big, using AI responsibly, and keeping a clear focus on value that goes beyond productivity.Functional leaders are at the heart of this change. By reshaping critical functions—including [finance](https://www.bcg.com/capabilities/corporate-finance-strategy/finance-function-excellence), [operations](https://www.bcg.com/capabilities/operations/overview), [HR](https://www.bcg.com/capabilities/people-strategy/digital-human-resources), IT, and more—executives can boost efficiency by up to 50% and generate significantly higher ROI.

But achieving this level of transformation requires more than adopting new tools. It demands a commitment to behavioral change, a people-centric focus, and sustained investment in foundational capabilities. Here’s how leaders can build future-ready functions and make AI pay off.

The Marketing Leader’s Guide

The Marketing Leader’s Guide

**What’s the Challenge? Easing the Pressure on Marketing.**  
Marketing leaders face demands from every side. Content must evolve quickly, consumers have higher expectations for personalized journeys, and ROI is harder to prove. GenAI offers a path forward, reducing complexity and providing teams with sharper analysis and insights. To utilize the technology to its fullest, CMOs need to rethink how the entire function operates—from brand building to execution.  
  
**What’s Possible? A Stronger, Faster Function.**  
To get the most from GenAI, strive for the transformation of marketing across three pillars:  

* **The Art of Brand Building.** GenAI can boost the creative side of marketing by building content faster and projecting your distinctive voice across channels.
* **The Science of End-to-End Activation.** How do you achieve better insights and enhance consumer activation? Put GenAI to work analyzing data, optimizing your media, and boosting your ROI.
* **The Orchestration of Your Portfolio.** AI can augment your decision making, planning, and project management with deep customer understanding and automated simulation.

The benefits show throughout the function. With GenAI, content cycles drop from six to ten months to just one or two. AI lets teams personalize at scale; marketing leaders can reduce expenses. You can now capture up to six times the ROI with end-to-end transformation.  
  
**Where to Start? Focus on Full-Funnel Workflows.**  
CMOs should plan to engage AI in core areas:  

* **Streamline content creation.** Use AI to automate briefs, speed up ideation, and make it easier to adapt content for channels and personalization.
* **Optimize campaign activation.** Use data and automation to simplify planning, execute plans with more precision, and improve ROI.
* **Sharpen portfolio planning.** Make faster investment decisions based on clearer insights and more effective tradeoffs.

It’s not just about new tools—it’s about reshaping how marketing teams work. The time is right to build a more agile, more effective function that’s fit for the future.

The Sales Leader’s Guide

The Sales Leader’s Guide

**What’s the Challenge? The Evolution of Sales.**  
  
It’s no small task for teams to adapt to the evolving B2B landscape, with its shifting buyer expectations, longer sales cycles, and heightened competition. Companies must use GenAI and predictive AI responsibly if they want to find a way through these challenges. Sales leaders can take charge of their function’s future with a transformational mindset that’s focused on data, technology, and people and process management.
